intro: Ruellia serrata, commonly known as the serrated ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, which give it its common name. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Ruellia serrata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a ground cover due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
